title: Data Analysis and Line Graphs

vocab.definition: A graph that uses points connected by lines to show how data changes over time
Information collected through observation, surveys, or experiments
A pattern showing whether data is increasing, decreasing, or staying the same
The numbers marked on the axes of a graph to measure the data
To explain what information or patterns a graph shows

teachingNotes: Practice reading line graphs showing changes over time. Teach students to identify increasing and decreasing trends. Emphasize the importance of reading titles and labels.

sample.question: What type of graph is best for showing temperature changes throughout a day?
A ________ connects points to show change over time.
The numbers along the axes are the ________.
A pattern that goes up or down is a ________.
When the line goes down, the data is ________.
When the line is flat, the data is ________.
The title tells what the graph is ________.
The ________ axis shows the measured values.
You should always read the ________ and labels first.

truefalse.question: A line graph can show how data changes over time.
A downward-sloping line shows an increase.
A flat line means the values are constant.
The y-axis shows the measured values.
The scale helps you read exact values.
A graph without labels is still easy to understand.
Trends can be increasing, decreasing, or constant.
Connecting points on a line graph is optional.
A good title should describe the data.

multiplechoice.question: If a line on a graph slopes upward from left to right, what does this show?
What does a flat line mean?
Which part of the graph tells you what the data is about?
If points are at 2, 4, 6, 8 over four days, the trend is ________.
Which helps you read the size of changes?
If Day 1=10 and Day 2=7, the graph shows a ________.
Before reading a graph, you should check the ________.
What is the y-value at x=3 if the points are (1,2), (2,4), (3,6)?
If the scale on y-axis skips by 5, what comes after 20?

fillintheblank.question: To understand a graph, you should first read the ________ and labels.
A pattern that shows up or down is a ________.
The numbers marked on the axes are the ________.
The horizontal axis is the ________ axis.
The vertical axis is the ________ axis.
A line going down shows the data is ________.
A line staying flat shows ________ change.

shortanswer.question: Look at a line graph showing plant height over 6 weeks. If the line goes up steadily, what does this tell you?
Explain how to tell if data is increasing or decreasing on a line graph.
Describe why reading the scale matters.
What should you read first on a graph and why?
expectedAny: title explains what the data is about

shortanswer.question: If the line goes up then down, describe the trend.
How can you estimate values between two points?
If two lines cross, what does that tell you?
What does a steep slope mean compared to a gentle slope?
Give a real-world example where a line graph is useful.
Explain how you would find the difference between two data points.

wordProblems.question: A line graph shows school enrollment from 2019 to 2023: 2019=200, 2020=250, 2021=300, 2022=280, 2023=320. What is the overall trend?
Weekly steps: 5k, 6k, 7k, 8k. What does the line show?
Temperature at noon: 60, 65, 70, 68, 72. Describe the trend.
expectedAny: mostly increasing with a small dip

wordProblems.question: Rainfall per month: 3, 2, 4, 5. Which month had the least?
Heart rate during exercise: 90→120→140→130. What happened?
Track time (min): 15, 14, 13, 13. What does the flat part show?
Sales: 10, 12, 9, 11. Which segment shows a decrease?
Population: 100, 100, 105, 110. What is the first change?
Distance traveled: 1, 3, 6, 10. Is the increase steady?
